about_the_game:
THIS ROSE-TINTED ZIGGURAT
Set in the modern day suburbs, a quiet neighborhood awakes to the sound of leaves, vehicles and falling tears.
Follow the trials of an unnamed woman in this horror & life-simulator hybrid as she attempts to pack away years of memorabilia, built with her family that now seems absent from her life and from this house.



TILE, WOOD, LINEOLEUM.
Experience comfort as well as fear in this narrative-driven horror about time, memory and the cost of nostalgia.
A Lovecraftian tale inspired by the works of Mark Z. Danielewski, Junji Ito and Charlie Kaufman.



FAMILIAR FACES AND EMPTY ROOMS
Explore and excavate the memories that stain the walls of this house, as the environment itself shifts and struggles with you and against you.
But watch your step, the entities that hold this house dear may not approve of your attempted departure.
Call upon relics of bygone love to hold this house together, keep yourself together and make it to the morning.

content_descriptors.notes: The game contains romanticizations of drug and alcohol abuse and implications of self-harm.

name: Kaleidoscope Chateau
short_description: Unpack the past and deny the future in this first-person psychological horror about the perception of memory, time and the lengths we go to control these forces. Find your remaining possessions and say goodbye to your shining castle, your diamond home, your Kaleidoscope Chateau.
